cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 50 miles NNW of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the Gulf of Mexico toward southeast Louisiana and the northern Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast, roughly between Morgan City and metropolitan New Orleans

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cameron, LA eastward to the Mississippi/Alabama border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for the northern Gulf Coast at this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: southeast Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, and portions of the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (>=39 mph) are likely by Sunday with a 70 % cumulative chance; hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out (8 % 64-kt probability).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 3–5 ft possible on Lake Pontchartrain and adjacent tidal lakes; 7–11 ft possible along the open coast east of landfall point.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches of rain with isolated 20 inch totals possible across southeast Louisiana, producing considerable flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, coastal flooding, and potential riverine flooding that may disrupt port operations.
